title: Kobold
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

- *This page is about the player [species](/Species "Species"). For the monster, see [Kobold (monster)](/Kobold_\(monster\) "Kobold (monster)").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Kobolds are small, mysterious creatures of unknown origin. They are well suited to lurking in the darkness of the Dungeon, and have a reduced range of vision which also reduces the range at which they can be seen by enemies.They are competent in combat, especially with short blades, maces or crossbows, and are comfortable with all forms of magic. They are also very adept at using magical devices. Their small size makes them unable to wield large weapons, but they are agile and stealthy, and advance in levels as quickly as Humans. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Skills and Equipment](#Starting_Skills_and_Equipment)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [6 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [7 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [7.1 Gimmick Builds](#Gimmick_Builds)
- [8 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [9 History](#History)

## Innate Abilities

- **[Nightstalker](/Nightstalker "Nightstalker") 3**: Kobolds' [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight") is reduced by 3, to a range of 4 squares. Their [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") is also increased by +150.

- Kobolds are **[small](/Size#Player_Sizes "Size")** creatures. They get a bonus to [EV](/EV "EV"), but have trouble with many items.

  - They are unable to wield many two-[handed](/Hand "Hand") weapons: [great swords](/Great_sword "Great sword"), [triple swords](/Triple_sword "Triple sword"), [dire flails](/Dire_flail "Dire flail"), [great maces](/Great_mace "Great mace"), [battleaxes](/Battleaxe "Battleaxe"), [executioner's axes](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe"), [halberds](/Halberd "Halberd"), [scythes](/Scythe "Scythe"), [glaives](/Glaive "Glaive"), [bardiches](/Bardiche "Bardiche"), [longbows](/Longbow "Longbow"), [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin"), and anything medium-sized species can't wield.
  - Large one-handed weapons: [magical staves](/Magical_staves "Magical staves"), [double swords](/Double_sword "Double sword"), [tridents](/Trident "Trident"), [demon tridents](/Demon_trident "Demon trident"), and [broad axes](/Broad_axe "Broad axe"), are two-handed weapons to them.
  - They are also incapable of wearing [tower shields](/Tower_shield "Tower shield").

Kobolds have a base [Strength](/Strength "Strength") of 5, [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 9 and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") of 10 (before Background modifiers).

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Warriors:** [Brigand](/Brigand "Brigand")
- **Zealots:** [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker")
- **Warrior-mages:** [Hexslinger](/Hexslinger "Hexslinger"), [Enchanter](/Enchanter "Enchanter")
- **Mages:** [Conjurer](/Conjurer "Conjurer"), [Earth Elementalist](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 to a random [stat](/Stat "Stat") every 5th level.
- 20% less [HP](/HP "HP") than average.
- Average [MP](/MP "MP").
- +3 [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") per level.

## Starting Skills and Equipment

Kobolds receive the skills and equipment listed for their background, with the following exceptions:

- [Javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") are replaced with [boomerangs](/Boomerang "Boomerang").

## Difficulty of Play

|                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Simple](/Category:Easy_species "Category:Easy species") • **[Intermediate](/Category:Moderate_species "Category:Moderate species")** • [Advanced](/Category:Hard_species "Category:Hard species") |

Kobolds' reduced LOS is often a good thing - monsters cannot see or attack until they are in *your* LOS. This makes sneaking and [stabbing](/Stabbing "Stabbing") easier, while limiting the range of enemies. It also limits your range, too.

Other than that, Kobolds are a straightforward race, with generally good aptitudes, fast leveling, and an EV bonus from size. As a low HP species, though, they are somewhat more difficult than average.

## Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

|                [Skill](/Skill "Skill")               | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |             [Skill](/Skill "Skill")             | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") | [Skill](/Skill "Skill")                            | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |
| :--------------------------------------------------: | :------------------------------: | :---------------------------------------------: | -------------------------------: | -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------: |
|                     ***Attack***                     |                                  |               ***Miscellaneous***               |                                  | ***Magic***                                        |                                  |
|           [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting")           |                 1                |            [Armour](/Armour "Armour")           |                               -2 | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")       |                                0 |
|                                                      |                                  |          [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")          |                                2 |                                                    |                                  |
| [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") |                -1                | [Shields](/Shields_\(skill\) "Shields (skill)") |                               -2 | [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")       |                                0 |
|                 [Axes](/Axes "Axes")                 |                -2                | [Stealth](/Stealth_\(skill\) "Stealth (skill)") |                                4 | [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")                            |                                0 |
|           [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")           |                -2                |                                                 |                                  | [Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings")             |                                0 |
|              [Staves](/Staves "Staves")              |                -1                |    [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations")    |                                1 | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")             |                                0 |
|  [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat")  |                 0                |      [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations")     |                                2 | [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") |                                0 |
|           [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")           |                 1                | [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting") |                               -1 | [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy")                      |                                0 |
|                                                      |                                  |                                                 |                                  | [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")             |                                0 |
|     [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")     |                 3                |                                                 |                                  | [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic")                |                                0 |
|       [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")      |                -2                |                                                 |                                  | [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")                |                                0 |
|  [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")  |                 3                |      [Experience](/Experience "Experience")     |                                1 | [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")          |                                0 |

## Strategy

### Gimmick Builds

Kobolds' tiny [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight") lends itself well to a few builds:

- [Wu Jian](/Wu_Jian "Wu Jian") / [Rampaging](/Rampaging "Rampaging") + [Stabber](/Stab "Stab"): Wu Jian's Lunge or Rampaging will allow you stab from 2 tiles away; for Kobolds, this is 40% of the screen. A [scarf](/Scarf "Scarf") of [shadows](/Shadows "Shadows") turns this into half the screen.
- [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy"): It is easy to fill all visible tiles with undead allies, severely limiting the number of enemies that can appear simultaneously on-screen. [Kikubaaqudgha](/Kikubaaqudgha "Kikubaaqudgha") makes it even easier.
- [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons"): Even with reduced sight, their Ranged Weapons skill is quite impressive. A range of 4 is still fairly decent, and ranged weapons are their best "heavy" weapon aptitude.

Of course, you aren't limited to these builds - a Kobold can do archetypical builds in both melee and magic just fine, though with a preference towards lighter armour.

## Trivia

[Kobolds](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kobold) were originally creatures from Germanic mythology, but they are well known to gamers due to appearing as low-level monsters in *Dungeons & Dragons* and as creatures in *Nethack*.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), Kobolds, as a small species, were more encumbered by [shields](/Shield "Shield"), but received slightly more SH from [kite shields](/Kite_shield "Kite shield").
- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), Kobolds had +2 [Crossbows](/Crossbows "Crossbows"), and weaker aptitudes in other ranged weapons, rather than +3 Ranged Weapons.
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Kobold [Fighters](/Fighter "Fighter") started with a [kite shield](/Kite_shield "Kite shield") instead of a [buckler](/Buckler "Buckler").
- Prior to the removal of the [food](/Food "Food") system in [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), kobolds were [carnivorous](/Carnivorous "Carnivorous"), but did not have the [Nightstalker](/Nightstalker "Nightstalker") mutation.
- Prior to [0.21](/0.21 "0.21") and the merging of [rations](/Ration "Ration"), the carnivorous mutation had three levels.
- Kobolds' aptitudes were rebalanced in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"). Prior to this change: [Axes](/Axes "Axes") was -1, [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") was 0, [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") was +3, [Slings](/Slings "Slings") was +2, [Bows](/Bows "Bows") was -1, [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") was -1, [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") was -1, and [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations") was -1, and [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations") was +3. Kobold base stats were also changed.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), kobolds had 2 ranks of [Saprovore](/Saprovore "Saprovore") and would recover from [sickness](/Sickness "Sickness") faster than normal.

| [Species](/Species "Species") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ----------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Simple                        | [Mountain Dwarf](/Mountain_Dwarf "Mountain Dwarf") • [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur") • [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk") • [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") • [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian") • [Troll](/Troll "Troll") • [Deep Elf](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf") • [Armataur](/Armataur "Armataur") • [Gnoll](/Gnoll "Gnoll") |
| Intermediate                  | [Human](/Human "Human") • [Kobold]() • [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") • [Djinni](/Djinni "Djinni") • [Spriggan](/Spriggan "Spriggan") • [Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul") • [Tengu](/Tengu "Tengu") • [Oni](/Oni "Oni") • [Barachi](/Barachi "Barachi")                                                                    |
| Advanced                      | [Coglin](/Coglin "Coglin") • [Vine Stalker](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") • [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire") • [Demigod](/Demigod "Demigod") • [Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid") • [Naga](/Naga "Naga") • [Octopode](/Octopode "Octopode") • [Felid](/Felid "Felid") • [Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy")                               |
html:
Kobold

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
This page is about the player species. For the monster, see Kobold (monster).
Kobolds are small, mysterious creatures of unknown origin. They are well suited to lurking in the darkness of the Dungeon, and have a reduced range of vision which also reduces the range at which they can be seen by enemies.

They are competent in combat, especially with short blades, maces or crossbows, and are comfortable with all forms of magic. They are also very adept at using magical devices. Their small size makes them unable to wield large weapons, but they are agile and stealthy, and advance in levels as quickly as Humans.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Starting Skills and Equipment
  • 5 Difficulty of Play
  • 6 Skill aptitudes
  • 7 Strategy
    • 7.1 Gimmick Builds
  • 8 Trivia
  • 9 History

Innate Abilities

  • Nightstalker 3: Kobolds' line of sight is reduced by 3, to a range of 4 squares. Their stealth is also increased by +150.
  • Kobolds are small creatures. They get a bonus to EV, but have trouble with many items.
    • They are unable to wield many two-handed weapons: great swords, triple swords, dire flails, great maces, battleaxes, executioner's axes, halberds, scythes, glaives, bardiches, longbows, javelins, and anything medium-sized species can't wield.
    • Large one-handed weapons: magical staves, double swords, tridents, demon tridents, and broad axes, are two-handed weapons to them.
    • They are also incapable of wearing tower shields.

Kobolds have a base Strength of 5, Intelligence of 9 and Dexterity of 10 (before Background modifiers).

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Warriors: Brigand
  • Zealots: Berserker
  • Warrior-mages: Hexslinger, Enchanter
  • Mages: Conjurer, Earth Elementalist

Level Bonuses

  • +1 to a random stat every 5th level.
  • 20% less HP than average.
  • Average MP.
  • +3 willpower per level.

Starting Skills and Equipment

Kobolds receive the skills and equipment listed for their background, with the following exceptions:

  • Javelins are replaced with boomerangs.

Difficulty of Play

Simple • Intermediate • Advanced

Kobolds' reduced LOS is often a good thing - monsters cannot see or attack until they are in your LOS. This makes sneaking and stabbing easier, while limiting the range of enemies. It also limits your range, too.

Other than that, Kobolds are a straightforward race, with generally good aptitudes, fast leveling, and an EV bonus from size. As a low HP species, though, they are somewhat more difficult than average.

Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude
Attack Miscellaneous Magic
Fighting 1 Armour -2 Spellcasting 0
Dodging 2
Maces & Flails -1 Shields -2 Conjurations 0
Axes -2 Stealth 4 Hexes 0
Polearms -2 Summonings 0
Staves -1 Invocations 1 Necromancy 0
Unarmed Combat 0 Evocations 2 Translocations 0
Throwing 1 Shapeshifting -1 Alchemy 0
Fire Magic 0
Short Blades 3 Ice Magic 0
Long Blades -2 Air Magic 0
Ranged Weapons 3 Experience 1 Earth Magic 0

Strategy

Gimmick Builds

Kobolds' tiny line of sight lends itself well to a few builds:

  • Wu Jian / Rampaging + Stabber: Wu Jian's Lunge or Rampaging will allow you stab from 2 tiles away; for Kobolds, this is 40% of the screen. A scarf of shadows turns this into half the screen.
  • Necromancy: It is easy to fill all visible tiles with undead allies, severely limiting the number of enemies that can appear simultaneously on-screen. Kikubaaqudgha makes it even easier.
  • Ranged Weapons: Even with reduced sight, their Ranged Weapons skill is quite impressive. A range of 4 is still fairly decent, and ranged weapons are their best "heavy" weapon aptitude.

Of course, you aren't limited to these builds - a Kobold can do archetypical builds in both melee and magic just fine, though with a preference towards lighter armour.

Trivia

Kobolds were originally creatures from Germanic mythology, but they are well known to gamers due to appearing as low-level monsters in Dungeons & Dragons and as creatures in Nethack.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, Kobolds, as a small species, were more encumbered by shields, but received slightly more SH from kite shields.
  • Prior to 0.29, Kobolds had +2 Crossbows, and weaker aptitudes in other ranged weapons, rather than +3 Ranged Weapons.
  • Prior to 0.27, Kobold Fighters started with a kite shield instead of a buckler.
  • Prior to the removal of the food system in 0.26, kobolds were carnivorous, but did not have the Nightstalker mutation.
  • Prior to 0.21 and the merging of rations, the carnivorous mutation had three levels.
  • Kobolds' aptitudes were rebalanced in 0.19. Prior to this change: Axes was -1, Maces & Flails was 0, Throwing was +3, Slings was +2, Bows was -1, Spellcasting was -1, Conjurations was -1, and Transmutations was -1, and Evocations was +3. Kobold base stats were also changed.
  • Prior to 0.15, kobolds had 2 ranks of Saprovore and would recover from sickness faster than normal.
Species
Simple Mountain Dwarf • Minotaur • Merfolk • Gargoyle • Draconian • Troll • Deep Elf • Armataur • Gnoll
Intermediate Human • Kobold • Demonspawn • Djinni • Spriggan • Ghoul • Tengu • Oni • Barachi
Advanced Coglin • Vine Stalker • Vampire • Demigod • Formicid • Naga • Octopode • Felid • Mummy

{{for monster}}
{{flavour|Kobolds are small, mysterious creatures of unknown origin. They are well suited to lurking in the darkness of the Dungeon, and have a reduced range of vision which also reduces the range at which they can be seen by enemies.

They are competent in combat, especially with short blades, maces or crossbows, and are comfortable with all forms of magic. They are also very adept at using magical devices. Their small size makes them unable to wield large weapons, but they are agile and stealthy, and advance in levels as quickly as Humans.}}

==Innate Abilities==
*'''[[Nightstalker]] 3''': Kobolds' [[line of sight]] is reduced by 3, to a range of 4 squares. Their [[stealth]] is also increased by +150.
*Kobolds are '''[[Size#Player Sizes|small]]''' creatures. They get a bonus to [[EV]], but have trouble with many items.
**They are unable to wield many two-[[hand]]ed weapons: [[great sword]]s, [[triple sword]]s, [[dire flail]]s, [[great mace]]s, [[battleaxe]]s,  [[executioner's axe]]s, [[halberd]]s, [[scythe]]s, [[glaive]]s, [[bardiche]]s, [[longbow]]s, [[javelin]]s, and anything medium-sized species can't wield. 
**Large one-handed weapons: [[magical staves]], [[double sword]]s, [[trident]]s, [[demon trident]]s, and [[broad axe]]s, are two-handed weapons to them. 
**They are also incapable of wearing [[tower shield]]s.

Kobolds have a base [[Strength]] of 5, [[Intelligence]] of 9 and [[Dexterity]] of 10 (before Background modifiers).

==Preferred Backgrounds==
*'''Warriors:''' [[Brigand]]
*'''Zealots:''' [[Berserker]]
*'''Warrior-mages:''' [[Hexslinger]], [[Enchanter]]
*'''Mages:''' [[Conjurer]], [[Earth Elementalist]]

==Level Bonuses==
*+1 to a random [[stat]] every 5th level.
*20% less [[HP]] than average.
*Average [[MP]].
*+3 [[willpower]] per level.

==Starting Skills and Equipment==
Kobolds receive the skills and equipment listed for their background, with the following exceptions:
* [[Javelin]]s are replaced with [[boomerang]]s.

==Difficulty of Play==
{{Moderate}}

Kobolds' reduced LOS is often a good thing - monsters cannot see or attack until they are in ''your'' LOS. This makes sneaking and [[stabbing]] easier, while limiting the range of enemies. It also limits your range, too. 

Other than that, Kobolds are a straightforward race, with generally good aptitudes, fast leveling, and an EV bonus from size. As a low HP species, though, they are somewhat more difficult than average.

{{species_aptitudes|Kobold}}

==Strategy==
===Gimmick Builds===
Kobolds' tiny [[line of sight]] lends itself well to a few builds:
*[[Wu Jian]] / [[Rampaging]] + [[Stab]]ber: Wu Jian's Lunge or Rampaging will allow you stab from 2 tiles away; for Kobolds, this is 40% of the screen. A [[scarf]] of [[shadows]] turns this into half the screen.
*[[Necromancy]]: It is easy to fill all visible tiles with undead allies, severely limiting the number of enemies that can appear simultaneously on-screen. [[Kikubaaqudgha]] makes it even easier.
*[[Ranged Weapons]]: Even with reduced sight, their Ranged Weapons skill is quite impressive. A range of 4 is still fairly decent, and ranged weapons are their best "heavy" weapon aptitude.

Of course, you aren't limited to these builds - a Kobold can do archetypical builds in both melee and magic just fine, though with a preference towards lighter armour.

==Trivia==
[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kobold Kobolds] were originally creatures from Germanic mythology, but they are well known to gamers due to appearing as low-level monsters in ''Dungeons & Dragons'' and as creatures in ''Nethack''.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.30]], Kobolds, as a small species, were more encumbered by [[shield]]s, but received slightly more SH from [[kite shield]]s.
*Prior to [[0.29]], Kobolds had +2 [[Crossbows]], and weaker aptitudes in other ranged weapons, rather than +3 Ranged Weapons.
*Prior to [[0.27]], Kobold [[Fighter]]s started with a [[kite shield]] instead of a [[buckler]].
*Prior to the removal of the [[food]] system in [[0.26]], kobolds were [[carnivorous]], but did not have the [[Nightstalker]] mutation.
*Prior to [[0.21]] and the merging of [[ration]]s, the carnivorous mutation had three levels. 
*Kobolds' aptitudes were rebalanced in [[0.19]]. Prior to this change: [[Axes]] was -1, [[Maces & Flails]] was 0, [[Throwing]] was +3, [[Slings]] was +2, [[Bows]] was -1, [[Spellcasting]] was -1, [[Conjurations]] was -1, and [[Transmutations]] was -1, and [[Evocations]] was +3. Kobold base stats were also changed.
*Prior to [[0.15]], kobolds had 2 ranks of [[Saprovore]] and would recover from [[sickness]] faster than normal.
